verses.kjv: When therefore the LORD knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,
verses.ct: When the Lord learned that the Pharisees had heard he was gaining and baptizing more followers than John,

verses.kjv: (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)
verses.ct: (although Jesus himself wasn't doing the baptizing — his disciples were),

verses.kjv: He left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.
verses.ct: he left Judaea and headed back to Galilee.

verses.kjv: And he must needs go through Samaria.
verses.ct: His route required him to pass through Samaria.

verses.kjv: Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
verses.ct: He arrived at a Samaritan town called Sychar, close to the piece of land that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.

verses.kjv: Now Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well: and it was about the sixth hour.
verses.ct: Jacob's well was located there. Jesus, exhausted from traveling, sat down by the well. It was around noon.

verses.kjv: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.
verses.ct: A Samaritan woman came to get water. Jesus said to her, "Can you give me a drink?"

verses.kjv: (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)
verses.ct: (His disciples had gone into town to buy food.)

verses.kjv: Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.
verses.ct: The Samaritan woman responded, "How can you, a Jewish man, ask me, a Samaritan woman, for a drink?" (Jews and Samaritans wanted nothing to do with each other.)

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "If you understood what God wants to give you, and who is asking you for a drink, you would have asked him instead, and he would have given you living water."

verses.kjv: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?
verses.ct: The woman said, "Sir, you don't even have a bucket, and this well is deep. Where would you get this living water?"

verses.kjv: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?
verses.ct: "Are you greater than our ancestor Jacob, who gave us this well? He drank from it himself, and so did his children and his livestock."

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto her, Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again:
verses.ct: Jesus answered her, "Everyone who drinks this water will get thirsty again."

verses.kjv: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.
verses.ct: "But whoever drinks the water I give will never be thirsty again. The water I give will become a spring inside them, flowing up into everlasting life."

verses.kjv: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.
verses.ct: The woman said, "Sir, give me this water so I won't get thirsty and have to keep coming here to draw from the well."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.
verses.ct: Jesus told her, "Go get your husband and come back here."

verses.kjv: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband:
verses.ct: She answered, "I don't have a husband." Jesus said, "You're right when you say you don't have a husband."

verses.kjv: For thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly.
verses.ct: "The truth is, you've had 5 husbands, and the man you're with now isn't your husband. What you said is completely honest."

verses.kjv: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
verses.ct: The woman said, "Sir, I can see that you are a prophet."

verses.kjv: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.
verses.ct: "Our ancestors worshipped on this mountain, but you Jews claim that Jerusalem is the proper place to worship."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.
verses.ct: Jesus said to her, "Trust me — a time is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.
verses.ct: "You Samaritans worship what you don't fully understand. We worship what we do understand, because salvation comes through the Jews."

verses.kjv: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him.
verses.ct: "But a time is coming — and has already arrived — when genuine worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and in truth. The Father is looking for people who will worship him that way."

verses.kjv: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth.
verses.ct: "God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and in truth."

verses.kjv: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.
verses.ct: The woman said, "I know that the Messiah (the one called Christ) is coming. When he arrives, he will explain everything to us."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.
verses.ct: Jesus told her, "I am he — the one speaking to you right now."

verses.kjv: And upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?
verses.ct: Just then his disciples returned and were shocked to find him talking with a woman. But none of them asked, "What do you want from her?" or "Why are you speaking with her?"

verses.kjv: The woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,
verses.ct: The woman left her water jar behind, hurried back into town, and told the people,

verses.kjv: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?
verses.ct: "Come see a man who told me everything I've ever done! Could this be the Christ?"

verses.kjv: Then they went out of the city, and came unto him.
verses.ct: So the people left the town and made their way to him.

verses.kjv: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, his disciples urged him, "Teacher, eat something."

verses.kjv: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.
verses.ct: But he told them, "I have food to eat that you don't know about."

verses.kjv: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him ought to eat?
verses.ct: The disciples asked each other, "Did someone bring him something to eat?"

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.
verses.ct: Jesus explained, "My food is to carry out the will of the one who sent me and to complete his work."

verses.kjv: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and then cometh harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.
verses.ct: "Don't you have a saying, '4 more months until harvest'? But I'm telling you, open your eyes and look at the fields — they're already ripe for harvesting."

verses.kjv: And he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.
verses.ct: "The harvester is already earning wages and gathering a crop for eternal life, so that the one who plants and the one who harvests can celebrate together."

verses.kjv: And herein is that saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.
verses.ct: "This proves the old saying: 'One person plants and another person harvests.'"

verses.kjv: I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, and ye are entered into their labours.
verses.ct: "I sent you to harvest what you didn't work for. Others did the hard work, and you have stepped into the results of their labor."

verses.kjv: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.
verses.ct: Many Samaritans from that town put their faith in him because of the woman's testimony: "He told me everything I've ever done."

verses.kjv: So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.
verses.ct: So when the Samaritans came to him, they begged him to stay with them. He stayed there for 2 days.

verses.kjv: And many more believed because of his own word;
verses.ct: Many more people became believers because of what Jesus himself said.

verses.kjv: And said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard him ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.
verses.ct: They told the woman, "We no longer believe just because of what you told us. We've heard him ourselves, and we know that this truly is the Christ, the Savior of the world."

verses.kjv: Now after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.
verses.ct: After those 2 days, he left there and continued on to Galilee.

verses.kjv: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.
verses.ct: Jesus himself had pointed out that a prophet receives no honor in his own homeland.

verses.kjv: Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.
verses.ct: When he arrived in Galilee, the people there welcomed him. They had been at the festival in Jerusalem and had witnessed everything he did there.

verses.kjv: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.
verses.ct: So Jesus returned to Cana in Galilee, where he had turned water into wine. There was a royal official whose son was sick in Capernaum.

verses.kjv: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.
verses.ct: When this man heard that Jesus had come from Judaea to Galilee, he went to him and pleaded with him to come and heal his son, who was close to death.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will not believe.
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "Unless you people see signs and wonders, you refuse to believe."

verses.kjv: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.
verses.ct: The official pleaded, "Sir, please come before my child dies."

verses.kjv: Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.
verses.ct: Jesus told him, "Go home. Your son will live." The man took Jesus at his word and left.

verses.kjv: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told him, saying, Thy son liveth.
verses.ct: While he was still on his way home, his servants met him with the news: "Your son is alive and well!"

verses.kjv: Then enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.
verses.ct: He asked them what time the boy had started to recover. They said, "The fever broke yesterday at about 1 in the afternoon."

verses.kjv: So the father knew that it was at the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.
verses.ct: The father realized that was the exact moment Jesus had told him, "Your son will live." So he and everyone in his household believed.

verses.kjv: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did, when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.
verses.ct: This was the 2nd miraculous sign Jesus performed after returning from Judaea to Galilee.
